climbs.name: The Holy Grail
climbs.fa: FA: David Johnson & Isaac Frazier 6/14/2013, FFA: David Johnson & Isaac Frazier 11/6/2014

content.description:
This multi-pitch sport route is the tallest in Hell's Canyon.  It has 4 eleven pitches, with the hardest moves at the very top.  You can rapel the route, 70 meter rope recommended (the third pitch is 30m), or walk off to the north.  This is a really fun route with a lot of variety.

As of 7/8/20, I know of only one other group that has climbed the route.  Isaac and I did the FFA trading pitches, so there is an opportunity for someone to snag the first individual free ascent.

I'm anxious to confirm the grades, so please let me know what you think after you climb it.
content.location: Approach trail heads off to the left (north) from the bottom of the drainage, then cuts back.  It is significantly more difficult to head straight up the drainage/debris field.  See approach image and topo.
